text:
Date: 22 Sep,2025                                                    Quiz 1. [CO 1]                                                                      Marks:20  
Demonstrate a solid understanding of fundamental concepts, terminologies, and principles related to 
algorithms, data structures, and algorithm analysis. 
Note: More than one answer may be correct 
Q1. If f(n)= amnm + am-1nm-1……………a1n+a0  and am >0, then 
a)  f(n)=Ω(nm)      
b) f(n) ≤nm ∑|ak|nk-m  ≤ f(n) for n≥1   
c) f(n)=Ɵ(kn) 
d) f(n)=O(2n) 
Q2. Given is a list of N randomly ordered numbers. Algorithm A finds (select) the smallest element in the 
list and exchanges it with the element present at the head of the list. After the exchange of the smallest 
with the element at the head of the list, the list is divided into two parts: sorted and unsorted. The 
process continues in this fashion until all the elements in the list are sorted. What is the time complexity 
of Algorithm A? 
a) O(log N)          b) O(N log N)              c) O(N2)      d) All options correct   
Q3. Compute the time complexity of the following code with an explanation: 
 
a) T(N)= O(m) +O(n)     
b) T(N)= o(mxn) 
c) T(N)=O(mn) 
d) None of the options are correct 
 
 
 
 
 
Q4.Compute the time complexity of the following code with an explanation: 
  
a) T(N)=O(mn)     
b) T(N)=O(logn logm) 
c) T(N)=O(m) +O(n) 
d) T(N)=O(nlogn logm)) 
(a) Int i=1; 
do 
         {  
             i++; 
          } 
while(i≤m) 
Int j=1; 
do 
         {  
              j++; 
          } 
 while(j≤n ) 
 
(b)   Int sum =0; 
        for(int x=0; x<n; x++){ 
             for(int y=0; y<m; y++) 
               { 
                  Sum:= sum + x+y; 
                }} 
               
 
 
Q.5 When does the performance of the MERGE-SORT algorithm degrade poorly? 
a) Compare elements alternatively        
b) The number of comparisons between two subarrays is maximum  
c) All elements are already sorted 
d) None of the options are correct 
Q6. A Quick Sort algorithm initially selects a value known as the pivot value. Numerous methods exist 
for selecting the pivot value. The pivot value serves to facilitate the partitioning of the list. The precise 
location of the pivot value in the final sorted array is often referred to as the split point. Consider a list 
containing N different elements. The list must be organized via the Quick Sort algorithm. Assume that 
the pivot element is selected uniformly at random. Determine the chance(probability) that the pivot 
element is positioned in the least favorable(worst) location during the initial phase of partitioning? 
a) chance(probability) = 0.759 
b) chance(probability) = 0.08      
c) chance(probability) = 0.05 
d) chance(probability) = 0.025 
Q7. Find the recurrence relation that represents the worst case of the Quick Sort algorithm? 
a) T(n) = 3T(n/2) + O(n2) 
b) T(n) = 2T(n/2) + T(0) + O(n) 
c) T(n) = T(n-1) + T(0) + O(n)    
d) T(n) = T(n-1) + O(n)     
Q8. Consider an algorithm that arranges the entries of a list in ascending order. The elements of the list 
are presented in ascending order. Which of the following choices is/are true? 
a) Quck Sort algorithm gives T(n)=O(n2) 
b) Merge Sort algorithm gives T(n) = O(n) 
c) Bubble Sort algorithm gives T(n) = O(n2) 
d) Insertion algorithm gives T(n) = O(n) 
I. a and b only 
II. a and c only    
III. c and d only 
IV. a and d only 
Q9. A merge sort algorithm is run on a RAM (random access machine) model. The RAM machine takes 
100 seconds (minimum time) for sorting of n=200000 numeric entries of a large data set. Find the 
minimum time that is needed to sort n entries. 
a) 0.000028    
b) 0.000012 
c) 0.000015 
d) 0.000010 
Q10. There are two sorted lists, X and Y , where list X contains M elements and list Y contains N elements. 
These lists are merged into a single sorted list K with n elements. Find the T(n), i.e., the order of the 
number of comparisons needed to produce list K. 
a) T(n)= O(MN) 
b) T(n)= O(M+N)     
c) T(n)= O(𝑀 𝑙𝑜𝑔𝑁) 
d) T(n)= O(𝑁 𝑙𝑜𝑔𝑀) 
 
I. a & b only 
II. b & c only 
III. Only a 
IV. Only b     
Q11. Consider the following function given below, and compute the returned value of the function. 
 
int unknown(int n) { 
    int i, j, k = 0; 
    for (i  = n/2; i <= n; i++) 
        for (j = 2; j <= n; j = j * 2) 
            k = k + n/2; 
    return k; 
 } 
a) 𝑛𝑙𝑜𝑔𝑛 
b) 𝑛2𝑙𝑜𝑔𝑛 
c) 𝑛𝑙𝑜𝑔𝑘 
d) 𝑘𝑙𝑜𝑔𝑛 
Q12. Arrange the following asymptotic complexities of functions f1, f2, f3, and f4 in increasing order. 
  f1(n) = 2n 
  f2(n) = n3/2 
  f3(n) = 𝑛𝑙𝑜𝑔𝑛 
  f4(n) = 𝑛𝑙𝑜𝑔𝑛 
 
a) f1, f2, f3, f4 
b) f3, f2, f4, f1    
c) f4, f4, f2, f1 
d) f1, f3,f4, f2 
 
I. Only a 
II. c and d only 
III. Only b 
IV. a and d only 
 
Q13. Let there be two functions f(n) and g(n); The relation f(n) = O(g(n)) holds true iff there exists positive 
constant c and k such that f(n) ≤ c ⋅ g(n) ∀ n ≥ k. On behalf of the definition, find the f(n) = n 4 + 35n 2 + 84 
 
a) Tight Upper Boun, f(n) is O(n 4), C = 2 &  ∀ n > 7 
b) Tight Lower Bound f(n) is O(n4), C = 3 & ∀ n < 6 
c) Loose Upper Bound f(n) is O(n3), C= 3 & ∀ n > 7 
d) Tight Upper Bound f(n) is O(n3),  C= 2, & ∀n > 6 
 
Q14. Let there be two functions f(n) and g(n); The relation f(n) = Ɵ(g(n)) holds true iff there exists positive 
constants 𝑐1 , 𝑐2 and k such that 𝑐1 ⋅ g(n) ≤ f(n) ≤ 𝑐2 ⋅ g(n) ∀ n ≥ k. On behalf of the definition, find   
f(n)= 3 ∗ 2n + 4n2 + 5n + 2 
 
a) f(n) is Ɵ(n2) ∀ 𝑛 > 19 & C1=21, C2=4, K=19 
b) f(n) is Ɵ(2n) ∀ 𝑛 > 9 & C1=2, C2=4, K=9 
c) f(n) is Ɵ(logn) ∀ 𝑛 > 9 & C1=2, C2=4, K=9 
d) All options are correct 
 
Q15. Find the solution of recurrence relation using Master Theorem T(n) = 4T(n/3) + n 
 
a) T(n) = O(n) 
b) T(n) = O(log n/3) 
c) T(n) = O (n2) 
d) T(n) = O(logn) 
 
Q16. The main objective of the fractional knapsack problem which statement(s) is/are true: 
 
a) To maximize the total value of the objects/items in the fixed capacity of the knapsack 
b) To maximize the weight in the fixed capacity of the knapsack 
c) The subset of the items added in the knapsack without exceeding the fixed capacity of the knapsack 
d) All options are true 
 
I. Only a  
II. Only d  
III. Both a & c  
IV. Both a & b  
 
Q17. Time complexity of fractional knapsack problem is ____________ 
a) O(n log n) 
b) O(n) 
c) O(n2) 
d) O(nlogn) 
 
Q18. Given items as {value,weight} pairs {{40,20},{30,10},{20,5}}. The capacity of knapsack=20. Find the 
maximum value output assuming items to be divisible. 
 
a) 60 
b) 80 
c) 100 
d) 40 
 
Q19. The main time taking step in fractional knapsack problem is ___________ 
a) Breaking items into fractions 
b) Adding items into the knapsack 
c) Sorting 
d) Looping through sorted items 
 
Q20. A list contains n elements, and all elements are unordered and distinct. To find an element in the list that is 
neither maximum nor minimum, how many comparisons are required? 
a) Ɵ(nlogn) 
b) Ɵ(logn) 
c) Ɵ(n) 
d) Ɵ(1)
